TITLE: Biden hoped for a big economic story to tell. Now, he's going small.
SUMMARY: The president is getting more micro in his economic sales pitch as the landscape loses its luster.

TITLE: US job market slows in April
SUMMARY: Friday’s government report showed that last month’s hiring gain was down sharply from the blockbuster increase of 315,000 in March.

TITLE: Trump Is Misleading You With Covid-Era Statistics. So Is Biden.
SUMMARY: Biden and Trump are both campaigning on warped economic statistics, cherry-picking weird data from the Covid crisis.

TITLE: US employers added a surprisingly robust 303,000 jobs in March in a sign of economic strength
SUMMARY: By any measure, it amounted to a strong month of hiring.

TITLE: ‘The last mile is harder’: Stubborn inflation stalls Fed rate cuts
SUMMARY: The concern is that higher rates are putting pressure on households and businesses looking to borrow, weighing on hiring, investment and the housing market.
